column4: hi i'm having problems with scp command, when running it in verbose mode I can see it issues the command: command scp -v -r -t -- , but those last to dashes confuses the receiving server, how can I configure those?
what's with the last two dashes?
I dont know where they are comming from, support guys just said that it was them that was confusing their server
do you have them in your command?
get rid of the -t
that's odd. You could try it the other way and ssee what hapens
ex: log in the remote machine and request the file from your machine.
I'll try, but I'm not sure I can log in on remote machine
you have to be able to push files to it
ssh needs to be installed on asolssson@server <<< otherwise you can't copy files that way
yeah, but I think they have closed the login
and I'm able to scp the files i need from another internal server in our company, just not from my laptop, and the only difference seems to be those two dashes in the scp command
So I just tried the channel to see if anybody perhaps had a quick answer ;-)
but their saying the 2 dashes are there you're not putting them in right?
and I don't know how'd they block ssh but allow scp
nvm that can be done. Try sftp maybe for the time being
right, I'm not putting the two dashes, but they appear in the output when running with -v.
I don't know that's wierd I would try sftp see if you can get in that way
I dont know how they've closen ssh access either, but I'll give sftp a try - thanks for your help!
I can confirm that scp works so it's some sort of problem with their setup not ubuntu or scp
yea' I can also push the files to some other server, with scp, and from that push them again to the correct location, but pretty cumbersome...
yeah then I would suspect the problem is the with the config of the server you are having the issue with.
yea' probably, thanks
